s.text: But throughout history, others haven't seen it that way, and past nominees for the Antichrist have included Nero, Napoleon, Hitler, and good ol' Mikhail Gorbachev, with his "mark of the beast" forehead.
It does sound bad, especially given the 2,000 year history of Jewish persecution by cranky Christians.

More precisely, he's a "pretribulational dispensationalist," an unwieldy label that refers to two separate but intertwined beliefs that were popularized in the early 1800s by John Nelson Darby, an English minister and a special sort of screwball genius whose ideas later spread to America.
Many, many of everybody will be killed.

When the seventh seal is broken, John learns that 144,000 faithful Jews, 12,000 each from the 12 tribes of Israel, together with great multitudes who "came out of the great tribulation," will ultimately appear before God, who promises them salvation.
